reviews.review: This game is very good. It is my favorite game.

Tough nut to crack

Current effect: When activated, you become invulnerable to damage and make a dash for a short distance.

Now a Hard Nut will give the effect of Durability for one second when activated. If you apply it in time, you will avoid the impact and get a boost to speed. This will remove the use of â€œDie Hard for Distanceâ€ and make it solely for avoiding blows, which the Killers can already expect and provoke accordingly. Smearing myself with a patch.

Un juego increible de estrategia y algo de suerte. Los elementos de horror lo hace interesante y con alta variedad de asesinos de licencia y originales. Es un videjuego para los que les gusta el reto y mejorar partida tras partida. Lo Ãºnico negativo es que el gameplay se crea en base las acciones de todos los jugadores de la partida, es decir, como es un juego de equipo puede que la experiencia sea mala si tus compaÃ±eros no aportan nada o tienen otras intenciones. AdemÃ¡s, debes estar en un buen estado mental para no frustrarte/enojarte si tos oponentes son tÃ³xicos o son swf.

i start the game, i do find match, error came.
start to find again, get invited by friends, i cancel, i joined, then error came.
re-invites by friends, we start again, got in a match, waiting for someone to be chased, we go gens.
random player gets chased, hooked. 5 gens completed.
gotta save the random player, killer tunneled, i help to distract,i got chased, hooked,
Friends healed the other player to help me unhooked. Didn't came and opened the escape door and run.
Killer didnt chase my friends, camped face to face. i died.
Game ended, results rewarded, -1 pip, bloodpoints used, error came. close the game. relaunch
Repeat from the start

Then banned my 1st account :|
Tiene muchos bugs y los  devs no escuchan a la comunidad.

I would 100% recommend this game to all horror lovers, this game is just simply something else. It is quite scary but it's not he scariest. I've had a few moments were I've been jumped scared but its not often. Another thing that I love about this game is the prestige system. I love how they make it so where if you can get a character up to a high enough level it will actually keep those perks so you can use them on other characters. The downfall to this game is the survivor nerfs. I think they need to balance out the game between survivors and killers. A basic run down of this game is there are four survivors and one killer. The killer objective is to find the four survivors and hang them. The survivors goal is to fix all the generators and open the door to escape. The fun part about this game is the pure adrenaline that comes from running away from the killer. Coming from a non horror fan, this game is amazing. The non stop grinding for Blood points (the games currency to level up your characters} and the fun I've had with my friends is truly UN-forgettable. I believe this game has been one of my top 5 games played and I will continue playing it :D. BUY THE GAME. Also this game isn't super graphic, I would allow my kids to play this.
great game if u wanna suffer
It's a game that i play and it's ok

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]
â™¦ DBD is a cornerstone of the asymmetric horror game-scape.
â™¦ It has its moments of greatness as well as its pitfalls, but the devs work really hard to squash bugs as they come up.
â™¦ There are some really creative original Killer characters, as well as horror icons.
â™¦ Survivor gameplay can be tedious and boring sometimes, but it can also be thrilling to barely evade a Killer's strike.
â™¦ Playing Killer can be the most terrifying and most satisfying experience in the game. There's nothing like the thrill of hitting a cross-map hatchet throw with the Huntress.
â™¦ There are microtransactions, but it's not as in-your-face as other games. You can earn most of the cosmetics by playing the game, but you have to play a lot. Would avoid if you have severe impulse control issues.
â™¦ There are some major reworks coming soon, which will probably drastically change the meta game, so if you're a player who decided to walk away, give it a go.

[h1]THE LONG VERSION:[/h1]

Dead by Daylight is a game that I have played since the summer of 2017. I started on console, which is where most of my progress lies. I have seen a lot of this game's history. I've made memories which will follow me forever in this game. I was there when they announced the Nightmare on Elm Street chapter. I remember playing against OG Legion when they had them on PTB. My friend changed his stream name to reflect a moment we experienced in this game. I've also purchased this game for my brother, fiancÃ©e, and some friend. So, to say that I enjoy it is a bit of an understatement.

As someone with a sports game background, I am not a stranger to playing against people online. The players in those communities are typical of many other gaming communities in that they talk a lot of trash. While this community has its toxic members, there are so many kind and accepting people in its ranks as well. We've all spammed the crouch button as a means to greet, taunt, and thank other players. And a lot of us know this, and appreciate the experiences that other players have had, and acknowledge the shortcomings of the game as well as our own play-styles.

There have been times I have doubted this game. There have been times where perks straight-up did not work on console, and sometimes that bleeds into the PC arena. Issues still plague the code, and there are a lot of things that need to be fixed, but it would be a mistake to say that the developers at BHVR don't care. The devs of this game, from an outside perspective, seem to be some of the hardest working people in the industry. Game development, after all, is hard work. But this team has been expertly squashing bugs for the five years I've been playing, and they deserve credit for that.

So, if you're reading this, thanks, devs.

That being said, I suppose I should actually review the game.

Dead by Daylight has been around since 2016, it is a 4v1 asymmetric horror game which pits four survivors in an eternal battle against the rotating roster of killers.

The original characters range from obvious references to horror legends to icons in the horror genre ranging from Sadako (Ringu) to Nemesis (Resident Evil) to Pyramid Head (Silent Hill) and the list goes on. Chances are, if your favorite horror legend isn't in Dead by Daylight, they may show up in the future. The objective of the killer is pretty much what it says on the tin: you have to kill survivors. You get a basic attack as well as a special power (which can range from projectiles to a one hit down).

Survivors, on the other hand, are responsible for repairing five generators and attempting to escape through the exit gates. There isn't a lot to say about survivor play, it's pretty much the same no matter which character you select. This is the role I have the most experience with, as I mostly play this game with friends, which is the best way to enjoy this mode. At the very least, you can share in the pain of getting wrecked by a weirdly matched killer. At the most, you develop an unspoken synergy that leads to you being a great teammate.

The graphics have recently been overhauled, and it looks different than it did when I started playing. Some players disagree on whether it's better or worse, but it's definitely more vibrant, which I appreciate.

The developers have also been reworking a lot of the killer chase music lately, to the point where if you play as Legion and use a Mixtape offering (a consumable item which modifies your power), you get a different type of chase music. It's neat little add-ons like this that make the game so cool to me, and help it stand out as a labor of love.

There are microtransactions and a premium currency in this game, which are the biggest marks against it. You can earn most of the cosmetics in the game by playing the game, but you have to play a lot. There is also a season pass for the Tome which costs about $10 at time of writing, and if you play a lot, you can unlock things like Auric Cells (the game's premium currency), cosmetics, and charms. To me, it isn't as insidious or in-your-face as some games, but again, if you have any issues with impulse control, it might be wise to avoid.

All told, I recommend this game to most players who are looking to play a good party game. It's the granddaddy of all asymmetric horror, as far as I'm concerned, and it's had staying power for a reason. If you can grab it while it's on sale, definitely do so; or if you have XBox Game Pass, you can play it as long as you have a subscription (again, as of time of writing).

In summary, if you are a horror fan who loves teamwork, as well as the thrill of winning a lethal game of tag, I hope that you decide to play this game. If you do, I look forward to seeing you in the Fog.

Thanks for reading, y'all.

This game is seriously so much fun to play with friends, whether with a team of survivors or in a custom match with the killer in the same call. It's the perfect amount of challenging and adrenaline-inducing fun paired with good rewards. I love how it doesn't punish you for being sacrificed, just rewards you based on your performance.
